p: Introduction: Acute Kidney Injury (AKI) is a serious complication in hospitalized patients, particularly in the critically ill, in whom AKI is independently associated with poor prognosis and outcome. Sepsis is the most important cause of AKI and its pathogenesis is clearly distinct from non-septic AKI. Here, we compared the clinical course and outcome in septic and non-septic critically ill patients worldwide.
